    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static OndusService login(java.lang.String username,
                                 java.lang.String password)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Main entry point for the OndusService to obtain an initialized instance of it. When calling this method, the provided credentials will be checked against the GROHE Api and an access token will be saved in this OndusService instance. The access token currently is valid for 6 months, however it will not be refreshed automatically. If it expires, you need to create a new instance of OndusService.
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the GROHE account
        password - The password of the GROHE account
        Returns:
        An initialized instance of OndusService with the username or password
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - If the login credentials are rejected by the API

      • getLocations

        public java.util.List<Location> getLocations()
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Locations are the top-level organizational structure inside the GROHE account. They're most likely used to separate multiple buildings or houses within one account.
        Returns:
        The list of saved Locations in the GROHE account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getLocation

        public java.util.Optional<Location> getLocation(int id)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a single Location object from the Api without querying for all locations inside the GROHE account.
        Parameters:
        id - The location ID as retrieved by the GROHE Api
        Returns:
        One specific Location
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getRooms

        public java.util.List<Room> getRooms(Location forLocation)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        A Room is an intermediate organizational structure element inside the GROHE account. It is usually used to separate multiple appliances in different rooms from each other.
        Parameters:
        forLocation - The Location to look for rooms in
        Returns:
        The list of saved Rooms in the GROHE account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getRoom

        public java.util.Optional<Room> getRoom(Location inLocation,
                                        int id)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a single Room object from the Api without querying for all rooms inside the GROHE account.
        Parameters:
        inLocation - The Location to look for the room in
        id - The room ID as retrieved by the GROHE Api
        Returns:
        One specific Room
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getAppliances

        public java.util.List<BaseAppliance> getAppliances(Room inRoom)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        SenseGuardAppliances are real devices from GROHE, saved inside the GROHE account. They provide an interface to the appliance's features and data.
        Parameters:
        inRoom - The Room to look for appliances in
        Returns:
        The list of saved SenseGuardAppliances in the GROHE account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getAppliance

        public java.util.Optional<BaseAppliance> getAppliance(Room inRoom,
                                                      java.lang.String applianceId)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a single SenseGuardAppliance object from the Api without querying for all appliances inside the GROHE account.
        Parameters:
        inRoom - The Room to look for the appliance in
        applianceId - The room ID as retrieved by the GROHE Api
        Returns:
        One specific SenseGuardAppliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getApplianceData

        public java.util.Optional<BaseApplianceData> getApplianceData(BaseAppliance appliance)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the BaseApplianceData saved for the appliance in the GROHE account. This method will query for the whole set of data saved for the appliance up to the (yet unknown) limit of the GROHE api. Consider using getApplianceData(BaseAppliance, Instant, Instant) to minimize the length of the result and the payload exchanged with the GROHE Api.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The SenseGuardAppliance to retrieve data from
        Returns:
        The SenseGuardApplianceData of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getApplianceData

        public java.util.Optional<BaseApplianceData> getApplianceData(BaseAppliance appliance,
                                                              java.time.Instant from,
                                                              java.time.Instant to)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        The same as getApplianceData(BaseAppliance), however, limits the requested data to a specific time range instead of requesting all data from all time.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The BaseAppliance to retrieve data from
        from - Needs to be an instance of Instant which is at least one day before to
        to - Needs to be an instance of Instant which is at least one day after from
        Returns:
        The SenseGuardApplianceData of the appliance in the given time range
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getApplianceCommand

        public java.util.Optional<ApplianceCommand> getApplianceCommand(SenseGuardAppliance appliance)
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the current state of the appliances ApplianceCommand saved for the appliance in the GROHE account. This can be used to inspect the current state of the appliance and activated/queued commands.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The SenseGuardAppliance to retrieve command information from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceCommand of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • getApplianceStatus

        public java.util.Optional<ApplianceStatus> getApplianceStatus(BaseAppliance appliance)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the current status of the appliance. Note that the available properties of the returned ApplianceStatus object may differ from appliance type to appliance type.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The BaseAppliance to retrieve command information from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceStatus of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • setValveOpen

        public void setValveOpen(SenseGuardAppliance appliance,
                         boolean open)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the valve state of the appliance. The call to this function is blocking until the API acknowledges the execution or failure of the command.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The appliance to change the valve state of
        open - The requested valve state
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs
